alert.note: Alert for Shoshone (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 04 at 8:37AM MDT until May 07 at 5:29PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Idaho... Coeur d Alene River at Cataldo affecting Shoshone and Kootenai Counties. ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Idaho... St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. St Joe River at Calder affecting Shoshone County. For the Coeur d`Alene River...including Cataldo...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING TO SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...St Joe River at Calder. * WHEN...From Friday evening to Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Bear Creek will begin to back up from the St Joe River and may start to spill into the town of Calder, flooding the low spots in yards, roads and parking lots. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM PDT Thursday the stage was 12.4 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late tomorrow evening. The river is forecast to crest Saturday and begin to slowly recede early next week. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (5 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun St Joe River Calder 13.0 12.4 Thu 6 am PDT 12.4 13.2 13.0 &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1015 PM PDT.
